title: Beware the Gifts of Dragons: How D&D’s Open Gaming License May Have Become a Trap for Creators

last_post.content:
Very interesting essay about D&D and the argument about the OGL (Open Gaming Licence). Received wisdom is that the OGL was a great way to encourage third parties (small companies, freelancers etc) to make D&D-compatible material such as adventures or sourcebooks - and that the apparently-imminent cancelation of the OGL is a distaster, screwing over the indies.
But this essay argues that indy creation was always possible (and preferable) without the OGL.
Fascinating.
https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2023/01/beware-gifts-dragons-how-dds-open-gaming-license-may-have-become-trap-creators

CSQIEP queer junior economist mentoring workshop 6/22-6/23 in Berkeley, CA. (Some costs covered for students, other junior scholars welcome.) Interested-please fill in this form:

This website provides the full back archive of BYTE magazine, all 23 years of it from 1975 to to 1998. It's a treasure trove of vintage tech and nostalgia, not even Archive.org carries all the issues.

The site actually focuses on old Apple magazines, but has also PC magazines and other resources on the history of microcomputing.

https://vintageapple.org/byte

#retrocomputing #magazines

title: Quote Tweeting: Over 30 Studies Dispel Some Myths - Absolutely Maybe

last_post.content:
I'd fallen for, and helped spread, what I now realize was a myth about quote tweets: That there's almost no research on them. Big mistake! Now rectified.

Here's my new post, digging into more than 30 studies with data on quote tweets. They don't settle all the questions. But there are answers, or at least partial ones, to most. It's still complicated, though.

It's a * very * long read, but there are summary points ....1/2

https://absolutelymaybe.plos.org/2023/01/12/quote-tweeting-over-30-studies-dispel-some-myths/

#MissedQuoteBoost #QuoteBoost #QuoteTweets

title: Allow optional Markdown and/or ReStructuredText interpolation · Issue #1274 · hometown-fork/hometown

last_post.content:
I keep getting asked to support writing rich-text-formatted posts in #Hometown (we already read them just fine). I finally wrote down, in this comment on this Github issue, a short essay outlining all my concerns with doing so:

https://github.com/hometown-fork/hometown/issues/1274#issuecomment-1379647384

Some of this is problems with Markdown, while some of this is problems with interoperability regarding any rich text rendering at all.

last_post.content:
Günseli Yalcinkaya's piece on E-girl psy-ops (via today's tabs @fka_tabs) is a full-on William Gibson novel, or at least 1,200 words worth of one:

"Here, cosplay commandos post nationalist thirst traps to mobilise the SIMPs, attracting the sort of impressionable reply guys and 4chan lostbois who message “OMG DM me🔥” on every post?"

https://www.dazeddigital.com/life-culture/article/57878/1/the-era-of-military-funded-e-girl-warfare-army-influencers-tiktok

So, you want to style all siblings sitting between a `.upper` and `.lower` element in CSS?

That’s possible … thanks to the almighty `:has()` selector!

```css
.upper ~ :has(~ .lower) {
outline: 1px solid red;
}
```

Details on my blog: https://brm.us/css-sibling-scope

title: Training the Button detector ML model

last_post.content:
I wrote up a post about how I trained an ML model to detect buttons and links.

The goal is to have a tool that looks at anchor tags and if they are styled like a button then let the developer know.

If you have experience building ML models, I'd love your feedback.

https://paul.kinlan.me/training-the-button-detector-ml-model/

title: Changes to AWS Billing, Cost Management, and Account Consoles Permissions | Amazon Web Services

last_post.content:
We will be making some very important changes to the AWS IAM permissions that govern access to the #AWS Billing, Cost Management, and Account Consoles, with the goal of giving you a set of fine-grained permissions for additional control. We are adding new permissions, and will retire others, so you need to pay attention!

To learn more, read Changes to AWS Billing, Cost Management, and Account Consoles Permissions at https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws-cloud-financial-management/changes-to-aws-billing-cost-management-and-account-consoles-permissions/

title: Generative Language Models and Automated Influence Operations: Emerging

last_post.content:
Everything You've Ever Wanted To Know about Generative AI and Influence Operations - a new report out today by my team at SIO, Georgetown CSET, and OpenAI.

That is not really the title. It's "Generative Language Models and Automated Influence Operations: Emerging Threats and Potential Mitigations". But it's a whitepaper hopefully of interest to both AI research and disinfo/influence ops research communities. :)

The science is settled on this. Poorly ventilated spaces are just plain bad for you, whether it’s pandemic viruses or air pollutants. It’s an easy fix for the most part too.
It’s finally time to take this seriously.
No more delaying, no more excuses.

title: Germany, EU remain heavily dependent on imported fossil fuels

last_post.content:
1.5 years ago Germany imported more than 60% of the gas it consumed from Russia.

Since late August 2022 it is 0%.

The scale of this change is incredible and would have been thought of as impossible in the past.

https://www.cleanenergywire.org/factsheets/germanys-dependence-imported-fossil-fuels

I wrote up how to use entity rules to override a textcat model in spaCy, which I covered quickly in my normconf talk: https://medium.com/@lynn-72328/using-rules-with-a-spacy-textcat-classifier-for-nsfw-content-26ca417611a #spacy #nlp #nlproc

Let's just step back and take stock of how phenomenal it is that @medium has created the me.dm instance, for their users on Mastodon (https://blog.medium.com/medium-embraces-mastodon-19dcb873eb11).

Medium is a commercial online publishing platform. Rather than see Mastodon as competition, Medium is offering their users me.dm, a Mastodon instance, as a benefit. Something which will make Medium more attractive.

Mastodon is a now a Medium feature.

This is new and revolutionary.

#twittermigration
